summary: This is an internal email chain from July 5, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It details plans for his arrest upon arrival at Teterboro airport from Paris, execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and coordination with the FBI and CBP.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Target of arrest and search warrant
persons.context: The subject of the planned arrest; scheduled to fly from Paris to Teterboro airport, with agents planning to arrest him upon arrival and execute a search warrant at his NYC residence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the detailed email providing updates on Epstein's flight, arrest plans, search warrant execution, and coordination with law enforcement.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is coordinating the legal and operational plans for Epstein's arrest and the execution of a search warrant.

events.title: Planned arrest of Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to fly from Paris to Teterboro airport, landing around 5:30 PM. FBI agents plan to be ready at the airport, coordinate with CBP to hold him upon arrival, and arrest him.

events.title: Execution of search warrant at Epstein's NYC residence
events.description: Following the arrest on Saturday night, agents plan to immediately execute a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence.

events.title: Expected court presentment
events.description: Given the timing of the arrest (Saturday), the expectation is for a Monday presentment in court.

locations: NYC residence (Epstein's New York City residence)
keyFacts: On July 5, 2019, SDNY prosecutors and the FBI were actively planning the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein upon his scheduled arrival at Teterboro airport from Paris on July 6.
The arrest plan involved coordination with Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to hold Epstein immediately upon landing.
A search warrant for Epstein's New York City residence was to be executed immediately following his arrest on the night of July 6.
The email chain indicates high-level, real-time coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding operational details of the arrest and investigation.
The timing of the arrest (Saturday) led to an expectation of a Monday court presentment.
